notesStmt.note: Marginal notes by different hands: Hand 1 (that of the scribe): folios 4b, 10b, 11b, 12b, 16b, 58b, 61a, 63b, 64a, 65a, 88b, 96a, 97a, 99a, 100b; Hand 2: title page (sale note), 99a, 103a; paper has horizontal single chain lines (22.5-23.5 mm apart)
Initial words in Sephardi square script

msContents.summary: This is a halakhic manuscript guiding scribes through the technicalities of writing a copy of the Torah scroll by hand. The first item is Kiryat Sefer by Menahem ben Shelomoh Meiri. It is incomplete, running up to and including ma'amar 4, helek 3 (folios 1a-41a). Curiously, while ma'amar 5 is missing, there follow two parts which might as well have been written by Meiri, since they form an organic whole with the preceding text. Item two (folios 42a-53a) offers an alphabetical overview of biblical words with their full or defective spelling. Item three (folios 57a-147b) deals with the issue of the correct spacing (setumot and petuhot) in relation to the text of the entire Pentateuch. The manuscript was copied by Raphael ben Joseph in Egypt in 1673/1674 CE (5433 AM). Moses Gaster wondered whether the scribe might be identified with Shabbetai Zevi's (1626-1676) supporter Raphael Joseph of Aleppo who used to live in Cairo.

msItem.title: Kiryat Sefer
msItem.author: Meiri, Menahem ben Shelomo, 1249-1316
msItem.colophon: ז"ל / והועתק פה מצרים ע"י סופר מהר בקי ?במלאת / הספרות במצות השר המאושר קדוש [...] רפאל ב"ר יוסף נר"ו / בשנת כל הכתוב לחיים / ליצירה ספר / קרית ספר / חברו הרב הכולל כמהר מנחם / הלבי לבית מאיר

msItem.title: Title page, with sale note by Hand 2
Kiryat Sefer by Menahem ben Shelomoh Meiri (folios 1a-41a).

support.watermark: Watermark AD on folios 125 and 126; folio 99 has a six-angled star cum crescent; folio 128 has a crown; folios interleaved with blank modern paper leaves without visible lines or watermarks

supportDesc.foliation: Hebrew foliation at the top outer corner of side a of each folio; title page unnumbered, folios 55 and 98 skipped by mistake, two folios numbered 73 by mistake; quire signature in pencil in Arabic numerals at the bottom left corner of side a of the first folio (modern hand)

layoutDesc.layout: Long line with 25 lines; no visible ruling; frequent rubrication into paragraphs; written dimensions: 150 x 99 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Title page: Gate drawing built up with many small pen strokes; shaped like a neoclassical temple with a tympan showing a large vase in its centre and two vases on top; columns with penwork imitating marble and stone, capitals and floral motifs

binding.p: Light brown leather with blind-tooled flower decoration on spine and around the borders of the boards; marbled paste-downs and marbled paper edges all round; blue silk bookmark

history.provenance: Acquired by The John Rylands Library from the heirs of Moses Gaster in 1954
